chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant John S Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: FTP - 4 mos RCJ consecutive to Ct 1

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John S Erickson

Defendant John S Erickson in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. The State files amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt and waives reading of same; enters NG plea. 
Pl to Cts 1 & 2 of amended information, the State recommends a fine.
P-G to both
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. Ct 1-$200 + cc, Ct 2 -$300.00 + including domestic abuse surcharge in Ct 2, DNA costs
                                          PP-$150.00 to begin 5/1 (must be paid by 5/7) . FTP-4 mos RCJ each count, conc

ADDRESS INFO for John S Erickson
Current: 135 N Hawley Rd, Milwaukee, WI 53213   (Effective: 05-05-2015)
Prior: 25110 Minnetonka Dr, Kansasville, WI 53139
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant John S Erickson in court with attorney Erin Larsen for  Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Defense requests bond conditions modification. State objects. 
BTC: Bond conditions are denied.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  No contact with the victim KAS (person, property, residence or family).   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant John S Erickson in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant John S Erickson in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
Defense and State request a two week adjournment. State and Defense stipulate to a bond modification. 
BTC: Adjournment granted.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits. Bond modification is granted. Bond is modified to a $750.00 sig bond. Same conditions apply.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
